meanings.sent1: After missing the first attempt, he had to retackle the opponent to stop them.
meanings.sent2: The football player had to retackle the running back to prevent a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: Trying to retackle the slippery fish in the pond was like chasing a playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: She had to retackle the challenging project with renewed determination.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to retackle the blazing flames to save the trapped family.

meanings.sent1: He needed to retackle his fishing gear to catch more fish.
meanings.sent2: The angler decided to retackle his bait to attract bigger fish.
meanings.sent3: She had to retackle her backpack to distribute the weight evenly for the hike.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic had to retackle the tools on the workbench for better organization.
meanings.sent5: The camper had to retackle the tent stakes to secure the shelter in the wind.

meanings.definition: To engage in a new tackle
meanings.sent1: The rugby player had to retackle the opponent to regain possession of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The defender quickly retackled the striker to prevent a goal.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully retackled each other in the backyard game.
meanings.sent4: The coach instructed the team to retackle the drill with more intensity.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler had to retackle his opponent to win the match.
